meanings.definition: To dance energetically to pop music.
meanings.sent1: She was boogalooing at the party all night long.
meanings.sent2: They love boogalooing to their favorite songs.
meanings.sent3: The kids were boogalooing so enthusiastically that they bumped into each other.
meanings.sent4: Her feet were boogalooing to the beat of the music.
meanings.sent5: The whole crowd was boogalooing in perfect harmony.

meanings.definition: A style of dance characterized by energetic movements.
meanings.sent1: The boogalooing at the dance competition was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The instructor taught the students the basics of boogalooing.
meanings.sent3: The boogalooing at the talent show brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: His boogalooing was like a burst of energy on the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The group's synchronized boogalooing was a sight to behold.

meanings.sent1: The wedding reception had everyone boogalooing joyfully.
meanings.sent2: The festival featured a competition for the best boogalooing performance.
meanings.sent3: Grandma surprised everyone by joining in the boogalooing at the family reunion.
meanings.sent4: The boogalooing at the concert was like a celebration of music.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter filled the room as they started boogalooing together.
